before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"pq5n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg6bm","text":"Preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a53em","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ae6c","text":"First, create a folder that will contain all your data for this project and name it whatever you would like. Within this folder, create two folders labeled ‘left’ and ‘right’ for hemispheres. If you only have one hemisphere of data, just create a singular folder labeled ‘data’.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fek5b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5nms","text":"After completing the QUINT workflow, you should have a folder (or more likely, multiple folders) called “Reports” which contains another folder with an ending label of RefAtlasRegions. In this folder will be at least two files with one of them having the same name as the folder. Ignore that file and copy the rest into the appropriate folder within the project folder you created in the beginning. Do this for every report folder you have until all the files are located in those two (or one) folders in your project folder. You may now open the website. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ao9v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"989hc","text":"This is a protocol for R shiny apps that accept output from the QUINT workflow (or similar mouse brain registration and segmentation data) and allows you to create grid and anatomical heatmaps using the Allen Brain Atlas CCFv3 for mouse brain data. The two applications are compiled onto a singular webpage at: https://github.com/MXHend/Mouse-Brain-Heatmap-Website","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":311,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"dp26h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2j42","text":"Anatomical heatmap","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72mpq","text":"Purpose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ahh0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5faed","text":"          This program plots regional quantification matrices composed of Nutil outputs in anatomical space (ABA CCFv3). This input matrix can be compiled using N2U or manually. Plots consist of coronal sections based on the Allen Brain Atlas and present options of single or multi-figure plots displaying your parameter of interest in anatomical regions and subregions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rbku","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"473tb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6abfr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"730di","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqh61","text":"Plotting Options","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bqdr","text":"
Users will have the option to develop Raw data single-figure or multi-figure plots with either the mean or median displayed for each anatomical region. Figure Numbers refer to the image numbers on the ABA website.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffp6l","text":"
Under the Raw Data single-figure tab in the MBH webpage, plots can be generated comparing regional data across conditions (MPI, Genotypes, Treatments, Markers, Sex) for a single figure. The Raw data multi-figure tab allows you to generate plots for multiple figures, consisting of coronal sections spanning across the brain, but will only display a single condition at a time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bhku","text":"
Users also have the option to plot at the daughter level by default which includes all atlas regions and subregions down to the specific layer/part (e.g. MOp2/3, MOp5, BLAp), or the parent level which plots more generally the main regions at the top of atlas hierarchy inclusive of all layers/parts (e.g. MOp, BLA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqu1f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j4pk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9phoo","text":"Notes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8msn","text":"
Min/Max: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96reo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2clul","text":"At the moment, the min and max can only be adjusted in N2U. If you would like to adjust the minimum and maximum values displayed, a new MBH Table will need to be created with adjusted min/max. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tmuc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A2AA23F99F2011EE886F0A58A9FEAC02","height":86,"id":432971,"is_video":false,"legend":"{"blocks":[{"key":"shba","text":"Example anatomical heatmap","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pg4pbn3yf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pg4mbn3yf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pg4nbn3yf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pg4kbn3yf.webp","width":550}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1j7fc","text":"Begin by hitting the browse button labeled for the ‘left side’ and select all files in the ‘left’ folder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a1lm6","text":"Hit the ‘open’ button to start loading the data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1pcva","text":"If you have a ‘data’ folder, select all files in that folder instead. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7tjca","text":"While that is loading you can hit the browse button labeled for the ‘right side’ and select the files in the ‘right’ folder and hit the ‘open’ button to begin loading that data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":69,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"earpg","text":"Wait until there is a message on the right side of the app that says the last side you loaded is done.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6kht1","text":"Double check that the above step has appeared and then click the button labeled ‘click this when all files are done loading’. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":81,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ngah","text":"Wait until the message on the right side changes and mentions the ‘blank annotation’ and the ‘checkpoint’ are done. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time

steps.section: Using N2U for the first time
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6l9ds","text":"Save this file as a CSV file with a different name so that you know you have completed it. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aqihq","text":"Check the right side of the screen for confirmation that the checkpoint is done loading and then click the browse button to input in the annotation file you finished creating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":124,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6vr7g","text":"Once that has completed (check the right side for text saying has finished), download Checkpoint 2 somewhere you have easy access to","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82ood","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13gs5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f9mgp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3v54k","text":"This will be for if you would like to come back to the app again later or if the app manages to fail at any later step. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2iu2d","text":"Once that is complete you may notice that the box labeled for selecting your ‘x axis variables’ now has options to choose from. Please note the following when you select these variables: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b55g5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h1sl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6k63a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bqk1r","text":" These variables will be on the heatmap going left and right.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cl0k9","text":" They will be combined and if they don’t make sense, such as combining ‘daughter’\n (region) with ‘mouse’, they will display inaccurate heatmaps or error out the program.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":87,"style":"bold"}],"key":"6hilr","text":" These variables will also be displayed individually in the form of a color key on the outside left of the heatmap.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5vcnh","text":"Common Examples:","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"110p4","text":" ‘Mouse’","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"auhnt","text":" ‘Marker’ and ‘Mouse’","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"avrr1","text":" ‘Marker’, ‘Mouse’, ‘Genotype’, ‘Sex’, ‘Treatment’, ’Batch’, and ‘MPI’ ","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"5gors","text":"Next, select the ‘y axis variables’ and note the following when selecting them: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dfqa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97m7j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dqrh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"carat","text":"These variables will be on the heatmap going up and down.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8cvlm","text":"They will be combined, so double check they make sense avoiding a similar issue such as
described for the x-axis.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a8hpp","text":"These will not have to match the display variables for the y-axis.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"6hq1v","text":"Common Examples:","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"beivv","text":"‘Daughter’","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"afjch","text":"‘Side’ and ‘Daughter","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e15d","text":"‘Side’ and ‘Parent’","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4s2a5","text":"‘Side’ and ‘Specials’*
    *‘Specials’ is a special variable containing the following ABA regions:
      CTXsp, fiber tracts, HPF, HY, Isocortex, OLF, PAL, STR, TH, MB, P, MY, and CB ","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8i72","text":"Select the ‘display’ y axis variables next noting the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hv61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73e3o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1qcn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ag2ea","text":"These variables will be displayed in the form of a color key on the outside top of the\nheatmap.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8jh4v","text":"These must make sense for this axis such as not using regions and mice together.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1h6th","text":"Please note that the more elements in a variable. the less distinguishable the color key is going to be (i.e. don’t use ‘daughter’) This is a good place to use ‘specials’.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":16,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"1k4m7","text":"Common Examples:","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ennme","text":"‘parent’","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cfd9l","text":"‘side’ and ‘parent’","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a7fra","text":"‘side’, ‘parent’, and ‘specials’","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"28sar","text":"When you have selected variables for all the above options, click the button labeled ‘Get Options’.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":86,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5k0f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sfg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8g092","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9vu8s","text":"This button will use the data you just gave it to give you more specific options for your heatmap. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"q6jt","text":"Next, look at all the options that are selected in the box labeled with ‘variables to see’ and confirm you want to see all of the above variables on the heatmap.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":73,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s6i9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbh6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31qc5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3mod2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ecmun","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bnvtj","text":"You will only ever touch this in an instance where you want to calculations to be the\nsame, but the display to only show part of it.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dnglp","text":"To not include something in the calculations, remove it using the annotation file. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"34lhq","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"esu71","text":"This step will determine the values of the heatmap, so pay close attention: From the dropdown list labeled ‘select the nutil variable’, select the variable you will be using as your value (i.e. Load)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":74},{"style":"bold","offset":108,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4v8uf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9118i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ln1k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eim1e","text":"Load is object area/region area so if you are looking for that calculation, this is it. steps.section: Using N2U when you have saved checkpoint 1 and completed filling out the annotation file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2nv1","text":"Select Use variables if you would like to select variables to create a percentage. Select the variables based on the following information: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vpbb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32a9v","text":"Segments by each variable labeled here and then creates percentages of any other variable you selected above that is not in this box. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q9u5","text":"Here the program will group your data based on your selections and create a percentage separating from the largest to the smallest designation. For example: ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fr8h7","text":" If your rows were ‘mouse’ and ‘marker’ (marker has two options per mouse), your selected nutil variable was ‘object count’, and you selected, ‘Mouse’, ‘side’, and ‘daughter’ here; it would first separate the data by mouse, then by side, then by daughter. Then it would look at the designations of the row and see that it’s separated by mouse and marker so it calculates the percent each marker takes up as it is already segmented by mouse.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ft3ca","text":"If you are hoping to compare the percentage of elements in a variable (such as ‘pSyn+’ to ‘pSyn-‘ in the variable ‘marker’), then do not include that variable in this segmentation as it would then turn out to be 100% for each of them ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"365vl","text":"Common Examples:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbcmn","text":" ‘side’, ‘mouse’, and ‘daughter’","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8onb","text":" ‘mouse’, ‘daughter’ ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b40p8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5iih0","text":"The color scale is not something you will need to adjust your first time loading the heatmap. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8qf2u","text":"Now that the heatmap is done, you will note some text at the top of the right side which says ‘min’ and ‘max’. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7r2vr","text":"At this point, you can adjust the options under the label ‘Custom Colors’. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":20},{"style":"bold","offset":102,"length":31},{"style":"bold","offset":154,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":178,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":185,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cosm3","text":"To save a variable as a csv file write the following code in the console:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9c43","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk0ca","text":".write.csv(variableName, “filename.csv”)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"731p3","text":" If you would like to designate the location of the file, include the file path in front of the filename  with all back slashes replaced with forward slashes ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":55},{"style":"bold","offset":111,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqgga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7151a","text":" “~\\projects\\file.csv” is incorrect","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8e6ap","text":" “~/projects/file.csv” is correct","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Input
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1dsl9","text":" Determine whether you want to plot single or multi-figure plots. Upload your compiled matrix by hitting browse on the prompt ‘Please upload the MBH table output’.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":127,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkanp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q52k","text":"This should be labeled as ‘MBHTable’ and is generated after selecting ‘Download MBH\ntable’ in the N2U program.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ngpg","text":" In theory, any csv file following the same format as seen in the MBH table would suffice\nfor this workflow. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9be81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Heatmap Colors
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8m31h","text":"If you generated a custom color scheme in the N2U app, upload the .rds file in the browse button under the ‘If desired, upload heatmapColors.rds here’ (not a necessary step if using the default scheme).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Figure Numbers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ik4m","text":" Select the Figure Number corresponding to the sections for your project.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Summary Level
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cj64g","text":"Select the measure summary you would like to have plotted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g489","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhqcr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1l760","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b2jnk","text":"Selecting ‘Mean’ will display in each anatomical region the measure of interest averaged across all sections for the conditions set (genotype, treatment, etc). Selecting ‘Median’ will display median values. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Region Level
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ffja","text":"Select the depth level for atlas regions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2smc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ts4t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ma53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8i4ac","text":"By default, the region level will be set to ‘daughter’ which will include anatomical regions split by layer/part. Choosing ‘parent’ will plot regions with all layers/parts combined as one region.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Conditions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"qb1d","text":" The remaining dropdowns allow you to choose what you would like to plot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Plot Data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"962vl","text":"Select ‘Plot data’ to create the heatmaps you have set. This may take time to load. Each time you adjust conditions or inputs you will need to reselect ‘Plot data’ to see the new plots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Plot Data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8065i","text":"‘Download Plot’ generates .svg files for generated plots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Plot Data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1a9di","text":"‘Download Data’ generates a .csv with information on what anatomical regions are plotting and the values being displayed in each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Figure Numbers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"88m7t","text":"This will only be one Figure Number if creating single-figure plots. Multi-figure Numbers should be separated by a comma without spaces between them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Figure Numbers
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5u5dl","text":"If you are unsure which figure you are working with, visit the ABA website and determine which section (out of 132) corresponds to the anatomical region(s) you are interested in plotting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Conditions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bh6c3","text":"Single-fig allows you to compare across conditions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cbib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2glvo","text":"The MPI, genotype, treatments, and markers can be selected for when plotting. The data for mice within the conditions set here will be summarized and displayed in plots.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvrc7","text":"By default, plots for each sex will be distinguished. If you would like to combine summary results across sexes, select ‘Averaged’ in the dropdown box under ‘Sexes to Plot’.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Anatomical heatmap - Conditions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5v4jh","text":"Multi-fig will only allow you to plot for a single condition","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6gjs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tfi8","text":"Whereas single-fig can generate multiple plots for each condition in the same output, multi-fig only displays a single condition at a time.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
